There is nothing worse than trying to fix code without a debugger. Since starting with Ruby, Pry has become perhaps the most essential tool for me to be productive and happy. Pry is the de facto standard for Ruby and acts as a debugger and alternative to IRB.

Install the Gem:

Ensure pry is available in your Ruby file and drop binding.pry in:

This will open up a Pry session where you can investigate the program state at that point and begin debugging.

The closer you get to your code the smaller your feedback loops, the more quickly youâ€™ll be productive. Instead of trying to guess what a variable is at that point in the program, just drop a pry in and find out for sure.

I prefer to use this approach most with a test driven development workflow where I am constantly invoking the debugging session by running the particular test I am working on.
